I've zipped up the latest SharpNEAT code and binaries, they can be found 
here...

http://www.cgreen.dsl.pipex.com/SharpNEAT_April9_2004.zip

The binaries are all now within a 'bin' dir and now include an 
application for simulating a prey capture on-screen. All you need to do 
is load the app, load a network xml file and click go!  There are some 
example networks in the 'networks' folder, a word of warning though, if 
the network has the wrong number of input and output neurons then an 
exception will be thrown, so be aware for now if you are modifying them.

The networks provided aren't particularly successful, though still 
intersting to watch. I have yet to see a perfect network for prey 
capture although this is very likely to be due to a flaw somewhere in my 
code! - I ironed out a few minor problems just today. To be sure though 
I think i'll attempt to port a more tried and tested problem domain such 
as pole balancing, that should help me gauge whether i'm looking at bugs 
or if I just need to tweak search parameters.

Colin.



Kenneth Stanley wrote:
